DataElement.preferredName: Cosmetic Product Material Grandfather Clause Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An article intended to be rubbed, poured, sprinkled, or sprayed on or introduced into or otherwise applied to the human body for cleansing, beautifying, promoting attractiveness or altering the appearance. Specifies whether the product qualifies under the 1938 Grandfather Clause, contained in section 20l(p)(l) of the U.S. Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cosmetic Product Material Grandfather Clause Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A substance that is intended to be applied to the body to promote attractiveness without affecting the body's structure or functions.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._An exemption based on circumstances existing prior to the adoption of some policy.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A substance that is intended to be applied to the body to promote attractiveness without affecting the body's structure or functions.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Concepts.definition: An immunotoxin containing epitope of Pseudomonas exotoxin (PE) with immunotherapeutic property. PE, a peptide toxin of 613 amino acids, consists of 3 functional domains: an amino-terminal receptor-binding domain, a middle translocation domain, and a carboxyl-terminal ADP-ribosylation domain. The last 5 carboxyl-terminal amino acids, Arg-Glu-Asp-Leu-Lys, are critical for its cytotoxic action.
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Property.preferredDefinition: An exemption based on circumstances existing prior to the adoption of some policy.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: An exemption based on circumstances existing prior to the adoption of some policy.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
